1.title: Senior Devops Engineer
1.description:
Join us as we pursue our innovative vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun and most meaningfully, to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Are you passionate about working on critical systems to create tangible customer impact? Would you like the opportunity to work at a growing company that is changing the way that information is used to support business decisions? If this resonates with you, we would love to speak with you.
The Developer Platform Infrastructure organization develops robust and resilient platform solutions for building, testing and deploying Splunk's enterprise software. The teams are fast-paced, high-velocity, and use state-of-the-art technology. The focus is always on automation, solving complex challenges that span across multiple groups within Splunk, ensuring smooth and expedient services to Splunk users.This is an incredible opportunity to utilize your existing system design, SaaS, cloud experience and drive the growth at Splunk.

Role

Lead/contribute to engineering efforts from design to implementation, solving complex technical challenges around scalability, reliability and resiliency.
Demonstrate service ownership and provide support to internal customers and stakeholders
Design and build advanced CI/CD infrastructure and pipelines; help teams debug and build projects and workflows
Develop tools and services that enable developers to quickly build and test software rapidly in a secure fashion
Mentor early career engineers provide technical and cultural guidance
Build a great customer experience for engineers using our Infrastructure
Provide self-service access for engineering teams to deploy, scale and access infrastructure
Participate in a regular on-call rotation in support of services owned by the team.

Requirements

CI/CD and tooling expertise. Cloud, container and virtualization experience. Innovating and scaling secure services on-prem and different cloud providers is a plus. You will use Kubernetes, Docker, UCP, AWS/GCP, Jenkins, Gitlab, Ansible.
Data structures and algorithms. A solid grasp of data structures, algorithms, and RESTful APIs.
Observability infrastructure expertise to ensure 24/7 operational excellence and data driven decision making.
Ability to work with multiple programming languages. We have code in several languages, ranging from Go to Python.
BS/MS degree in EE or CS or a related technical field or 5+ years of progressive experience.
Desire to learn and adapt. You will constantly be learning new areas and new technologies.
Passion. Our customers are passionate about Splunk, and we want the same from our engineers. We want you to be excited and have utmost ownership of your projects



What we offer

Opportunities to develop and grow as an engineer. We are always expanding into new areas, working with open-source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
A team of incredibly capable and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support.
Breadth and depth. The team works in a broad problem domain where there are always new challenges or areas to solve.
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and opportunities. We also believe that mentors help both sides of the equation.
Fun. We have frequent group outings and team building events. We are committed to having every employee want to give it their all, be respectful and a part of the family, and have a smile on their face while doing it.

2.title: Quality Assurance Specialist
2.description:
As an QUALITY ASSURANCE SPECIALIST, you will design, create and built test cases, test plans and test strategies for multiple software platforms along with automation test scripts for all applications.

Main Responsibilities:

Crafting, creating, and building test cases, test plans and test strategies for multiple software platforms
Deliver quality products by thoroughly testing throughout testing phase of development life cycle by using a combination of testing methods.
As a professional with excellent communication skills you will be leading and coordinating work across teams and QA analysts
Collaborating to define, organize and plan for both; functional and test automation (for one or more projects).
Communicate, prioritize and track test execution, defects and issues appropriately and recommend corrective action whenever required. Implement functional testing, regression testing and UI/UX testing, for all new features in cross browser environments (including mobile devices if needed).
Participating on Agile ceremonies, being focused on requirement definition/refinement as early in the SDLC as possible.
Collaborate with the Software Development teams and other Product Owners to understand the requirements and develop and manage the test scenarios for all the new development projects. Log, communicate, prioritize and track defects and issues appropriately and recommend corrective action whenever required.
Work with development team and Database Administrators to identify system deficiencies and escalate to appropriate teams for timely resolution of issues.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline,
5 years or more of work experience and technical training (Code Bootcamp, etc.).
Understanding of basic concepts, terminology and practical application of current and emerging technologies.
Extensive analytical abilities and technical skills to evaluate alternative approaches and to recommend the most feasible and economical solutions.
Working understanding of software architecture including programming languages, databases and data interchange approaches.
Extensive analytical abilities and technical skills to isolate problems, fix immediate needs, analyze all ramifications and implement complete solutions.
Define, organize, plan, and execute projects from vision through implementation.
Excellent English (both verbal and written) and communication skills
Ability to work without close supervision, keeping focused on short and long-term objectives. Looking towards continuous learning and growing.

This job posting may have multiple locations listed. A successful candidate may work remotely and not be offered to relocate.
About us:Here at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.

We trust our people every day, in every way.We enable and empower our people to make the right decisions. We are inclusive, transparent and respectful. Our feedback is clear and actionable.
We make it happen.We have a passion for winning. We achieve. We deliver with discipline and integrity. We bring our best energy to our work. We decide and act intelligently and quickly.
We run it like we own it.We respect one another by being responsible and accountable. We always act in the best interest of our company, customers, shareholders and our communities.

3.title: Principal Software Engineer
3.description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Are you passionate about working on products that make a difference for your customers? Do you enjoy building large scale applications that are powered by huge data sets? Do you value working in an environment where you're empowered to make key technical decisions across a full stack of technologies? If so, a role on Splunk’s Security Analytics team would be a great fit for you.

Role

We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer to help lead, design, develop and deliver Splunk's User Behavior Analytics (UBA) security analytics solution that detects known and unknown security threats at scale using big data and machine learning techniques. Delivered on customer managed resources using Kubernetes and Spark to run innovative stream processing and machine learning algorithms in near real-time, UBA helps security analysts quickly identify and resolve threats.

We are a passionate team who care deeply about our customers and our teammates. In this role, you will work directly with Product Management, our Design Team, our Customers and other engineering teams to help derive the best experience for the customer. We have a lean process that focuses on empowering and serving our engineers as opposed to just directing them.

Responsibilities

Achieve a deep knowledge of our product architecture, usage patterns, and real world use-cases in order to better understand what solutions will bring value to our customers
Develop new product features, clarify and improve designs, and help put together a plan for how to make it happen (using Agile Methodologies)
Collaborate closely with Product Management and members of our team to design and create comprehensive end-to-end user workflows
Keep product quality top of mind by extensively using Continuous Integration/Continuous Development (CI/CD), testing technologies (unit, functional, performance), and best practices to ensure that the product is of high quality
Champion, coach and mentor others to solve problems in new and creative ways with the goal to maintain team efficiency and morale

Experience

Required:

Java and/or Scala programming experience
Familiarity with streaming and distributed computing technologies such as Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Impala, Postgres
Exposure to working with container ecosystems (Docker, Kubernetes, Kubernetes Operator Framework)
Knowledge of distributed computing architectures and principles that solve for scalability, performance, redundancy and reliability
Experienced with an Agile DevOps engineering environment that effectively uses CI/CD pipelines such as GitLab
Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills, specifically a proven ability to effectively work with others within a dynamic environment
Ability to learn new technologies quickly and to understand a wide variety of technical challenges to be solved
12 years of related experience with a technical Bachelor’s degree; or equivalent practical experience; or 10 years and a technical Master’s degree; or a Ph.D. with 9 years experience; or equivalent practical experience

Desired:

Background in developing machine learning products for the Security market 
Experience in building an ETL pipeline with high-volume data ingestion
Examples of leadership and architecture design of big data and ML based platforms
Familiarity with Splunk’s Security products 

What We Offer You

A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies
A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment

4.title: Engineering Manager
4.description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.

UBA helps security analysts quickly identify and resolve threats; delivered on customer managed resources using Kubernetes and Spark to run innovative stream processing and machine learning algorithms in near real-time.

This is an exciting engineering leadership role to lead and develop a team of passionate engineers. This team will deliver product features and enhancements as well as fixes and solutions to Splunk’s customers with rapid turn-around time, raising customer satisfaction. We are looking for a leader that has both strong technical abilities and experience building relationships with the Customer Success, Support, and the Field organization. Furthermore, the manager will play a vital role in product innovation by working closely with product management and other engineering teams to build and enhance the Splunk product in terms of new features with quality, diagnosability, and usability at the forefront.

As a leader in the UBA Engineering group, you'll also be deeply involved in roadmap planning, structuring our organization, and collaborating with a large network of software and security professionals. Splunk's teams are distributed in multiple locations; the right candidate will need to have excellent communication and leadership skills which transcend the geographic divides.

What We Offer You:

A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
A set of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.

Responsibilities:

Lead a team of high skilled frontend and backend engineers and serve as coach, mentor and technical adviser.
Working closely with the rest of the leadership and product management team on product strategy and roadmap refinement with the customer first thinking.
Passionate about good engineering practices, new technologies, and improving processes, and a consistent record of mentoring and coaching team members.
Lead the creation of features and product releases by being closely involved with the product development, design, and review.
Experience developing and delivering scalable enterprise products.
CI/CD is a top priority for us as we further mature our development model. A successful manager will champion code quality among the team by actively participating in code reviews, test plan development, and holding ourselves accountable for writing appropriate automated tests.
Work closely with developers and architects on technical decisions throughout the development lifecycle.
Work with other team leads from across the product organization on inter-area projects, help identify the critical paths of components, and resolve dependencies.
Hold regular 1:1s with direct reports, help them navigate challenges, and coach them for their career development.
Plan & implement strategies to help team align with the organizational goals.

Requirements:

5+ years of experience in product engineering leadership roles directly managing highly technical engineers.
Able to build teams by attracting & retaining talent in a fiercely competitive environment.

Nice to have skills
Experience working in or leading engineering teams distributed across geographies and timezones.
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.

5.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
5.description:
Join us as we pursue our innovative vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun and most meaningfully, to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!What we’re looking forWe are looking for a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to help design and build the next generation of our large scale Cloud offering. You will be developing the internal platform and supporting the implementation of Splunk’s own Enterprise product within Splunk, used extensively within the company, and one of the largest scale systems of its size in the world.

What you provide


Familiarity with cloud environments. We operate in AWS, GCP, and more in future. You are familiar with at least one of these, and willing to learn the rest.

Familiarity with SRE and devops tooling. You are familiar with terraform, puppet, and git, and have used them for managing production infrastructure.

Familiarity with programming languages. You are comfortable with either Python or Go, and willing to learn the other. If you already know both, that’s great!

Familiarity with observability systems and tools. You have experience with log management solutions like Splunk Enterprise or Elastic or similar. You also have experience with metrics management systems like Prometheus or SignalFX or similar. You don’t need to already know the Splunk products, but you must be willing to learn.

Desire to learn and adapt. Our agile team has a lot of projects going on at once, and you'll have the opportunity to learn to navigate the code and features. You'll constantly be learning new areas and new technologies.

Passion. Our customers are passionate about Splunk, and we want the same from our engineers. We want you to actively own your work and be excited about your projects.

Drive for automation. You constantly consider, "How can I automate this manual process?" You will use Terraform to manage various cloud infrastructure resources. An understanding of Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) and declarative configuration languages as preferred.

Knowledge of technical excellence. You know continuous delivery, automated testing, security methodologies, system performance, and disaster recovery concepts.

Operational excellence. Data excites you and you make decisions based on numbers rather than assumptions. If an issue arises, you strive to be alerted before our customers notice.

Keeping calm and carrying on. Capable in navigating through a product outage, skilled in identifying performance bottlenecks, spotting anomalous system behavior, and figuring out the root cause of incidents.

Linux proficiency. Excited to apply system administration experience and comfort in developing or creatively addressing challenges via a linux/unix console.

Self-sufficiency. You work independently, learn quickly, and build relationships with people easily. You do not need to have a manager supervising you closely in your day to day work, and can independently lead a project to success.

Though not required, it is also awesome if you have built scalable secure services on cloud providers such as AWS, and have some Splunk expertise.

What we provide


Opportunities to develop and grow as an engineer. We are always expanding into new areas, working with open-source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.

A team of incredibly capable and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support.

Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe that mentors help both sides of the equation.

A stable, collaborative, and supportive work environment. We work in an open environment, work together to get things done, and adapt to the changing needs for the team.

Balance. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and commitment, and believe that balance helps cultivate a positive environment.

We value diversity, equity, and inclusion at Splunk and are an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

6.title: IT Automation Engineer

7.title: Senior Software Engineer
7.description:
The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.
Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.
We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?
About the roleAs a Software Engineer on the XM Discover Platform scrum development team, you will be collaborating with other progressive engineers to  bring our software to the next levels of scalability, performance, security, and functionality.  This stack processes very large amounts of data using a variety of open-source technologies such as Java, Elastic, Kafka, Spring, Docker, Kubernetes, Postgres, Jenkins, Ansible, and others.  In this role there is lots of opportunity for growth - you will start with responsibility for both story-level and epic-level work, and broaden out from there.  As with all of our engineering roles, you will have influence on design and implementation and will be able to both mentor and be mentored.
About the team:We are a scrum shop and happy to teach and mentor if you don’t have previous scrum experience.  If you do have scrum experience, then you’ll be happy to know that we do full scrum, complete with sprint planning, review, retrospectives, daily scrums, backlog refinement, and planning poker. We also embrace XP development methodologies and put great value on XP development principles.
XM Discover provides a deep understanding of customers and employees by evaluating the actual words they use. The industry's leading AI-powered speech and text analytics engine analyzes all feedback and conversations at scale to reveal topics, perception of effort, emotion, empathy, sentiment, reasons for actions, intent and more. Insights from XM Discover are used to build a more holistic experience management (XM) strategy and stronger relationships with employees and customers as a result.
As a Senior Software Engineer at Qualtrics, you should love building simple solutions to solve hard scalability problems. Designing systems in an agile environment to withstand hyper growth and owning quality from end to end is a rewarding challenge and one of the reasons Qualtrics is such an exciting place to work.
In Addition, You Will:
Develop scalable, fast, robust, and simple web-based solutions to solve complex business problems
Implement new features and optimize existing ones to drive maximum performance
Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from other engineers, tech-ops, and product managers
Attend daily stand-up meetings, collaborate with your peers, prioritize features, and work with a sense of urgency to deliver value to your customers

Experience Required:

4+ years of relevant experience 
Strong level of curiosity and interest to learn
Strong algorithms, data structures and coding background
Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance
Experience with Microservices Architecture and distributed systems
Experience with professional software engineering practices (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design documents)
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

What differentiates us from other companies:

Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours.
We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.
On top of the standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.
We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees.
#Krakow

11.title: Engineering Team Lead (Offer&Hire Team)
11.description:
🚀 SmartRecruiters is building an operating system (SaaS product hosted on AWS and GCP) for recruiting and is on a mission to connect people with jobs at scale. The company is growing quickly and recently hit the 1.5 billion dollar valuation. The system is used by over 4,000 companies, including employees at LinkedIn, McDonald's, CD Bosch, Allegro, and many more! Our engineering team solves one of the most important problems of the modern economy - connecting great people with great jobs. We supported over 100M job seekers to date! 💪 🚀 
Our system is composed of hundreds of independent services (each sitting on Docker, orchestrated by Kubernetes). We build most of our services in Java and do over 2000 production deployments per month, maintaining an uptime of 99.98. We are looking for an Engineering Team Lead to help us build the next chapter of that vision. 
🚀 Our engineering organization is built with small, cross-functional teams where Engineers, Product Managers, and Product Designers work side by side to solve customer problems. Each team owns a part of our business and takes care of it, from feature ideas to usage analysis.Offer & Hire Team believes every organization should be able to allow their applicants to safely control data consent, be able to engage their candidates with a smooth offering experience, and be able to ensure their candidates' hire is efficiently administered.
We are looking for an experienced engineer that would like to grow as a people leader. Engineering Team Leads at SmartRecruiters spend around 50% of their time managing people and collaborating with stakeholders and 50% of their time designing and building products. Team Leads represent their teams externally, help others grow, and ensure the team's discovery and delivery work runs smoothly. 

You may be located anywhere in Poland and work remotely or out of our Cracow office!What will you do:

Collaborate with Product Managers and Product Designers on building the next-generation product
Oversee roadmap discovery and delivery
Take ownership of the designated services
Drive engineering excellence inside the team
Mentor and coach other engineers
Contribute to the full life-cycle of the product (including problem discovery, prototyping, design, implementation, and measuring adoption)
Build services with Java / Node.js (Express, Nest.js) / Angular - depending on your background (frontend/backend)
Qualifications
Experience in designing, developing, and operating distributed web-based systems
Experience in supporting end-to-end product lifecycle (from product discovery, solutioning, system design, implementation, production rollout, and optimization)
Passion for supporting team members in their career growth
Excellent technical project management and communication skills
Good understanding of agile processes and techniques
Good command of one of the programming languages like Java, Javascript or Kotlin
Strong domain modeling skills - including refactoring existing domains
Strong command of the English language, both written and verbal

We support 100% remote work with Wi-Fi reimbursement and an additional stipend for the equipment (the MacBook laptop is provided by us)

12.description:

15.title: Security Architect
15.company_name: Standard Chartered GBS Sp. z o.o.
15.description:
Security Architect
THE ROLE RESPONSIBILIETIES:

Become a trusted advisor and subject matter expert (SME) on security architecture. provide deep architectural expertise on complex cloud and on-premises projects,  
Deliver workable risk/threat-driven solutions with cost/benefit analysis. 
Communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, provide guidance on proper architectural patterns. Identify and mitigate anti-patterns, redundancies, and duplications.  
Perform gap analysis for specific domains, identify gaps in existing capabilities, service maturity.  
Identify missing cybersecurity and cyber-resilience capabilities in alignment with changing business needs, threat land scape and technical requirements to increase the quality of the selected solutions also including topics such as products’ convergence over time and products decommissioning. 
Define and manage architecture artefacts including reference architecture documents, blueprints, technical and non-technical security requirements aligned to the corresponding strategic roadmap. 
Aligns architecture principles with our cybersecurity strategy, ensures alignment to roadmaps, cyber security, and resiliency standards as well as to our architectural framework.  
Responsible for security architectural design, realisation of the architecture in the solution implementation roadmap. 
Analyse market trends and threat landscape, provide meaningful insights, opportunities, and risks. 
Represent the architecture group in key internal service architecture governance forums.  
Work closely with your pears in the security architecture group, service and solution architects, engineers, project teams. 
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE:
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, preferably majoring in cybersecurity.    
3 and more years of experience in security architecture roles, leading complex architectural projects with multiple stakeholders, utilizing various security tools/technologies. 
2-3 years hands-on experience (coding in Java, JS, Python) ideally full stack development.
Proven threat modelling experience using STRIDE/MITRE/OWASP and/or other threat modelling methodologies for complex systems (ideally MITRE ATT&CK Defenders (MAD) Certified). 
1-2 years of experience in networking architecture and/or networking security architecture and/or AWS networking specialty certified / Cisco CCNP Security / etc. 
Deep technical skills with good understanding in cross-functional technologies (IAM, data protection, threat management, vuln management, etc.) ability to dive into technical engineering details. 
Experience in offensive tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), pen-testing / hacking background or (OSCP, CEH master) certified. 
Excellent communication skills, ability to explain complex topics to both technical and non-technical audiences. Proven ability to influence relevant stakeholders and decision makers. 
Excellent organisational skills, ability to manage deadlines and effectively prioritise multiple projects.

Role Specific Technical Competencies:

Experience working in security architecture / engineering roles for financial institutes.
Relevant cybersecurity certifications (AWS/Google/Microsoft Certified Security specialist, architect, GDSA, SANS GIAC, CISSP-ISSAP).
AWS solutions architect professional certified and 3 years of experience in AWS environment or 5 hands-on years equivalent experience in AWS solution architecture.
In depth understanding of threat-attack methodologies (STRIDE, DREAD, OWASP, Attack trees, MITRE ATT&CK, etc.) and corresponding mitigations in an enterprise environment.
Experience with cybersecurity frameworks e.g., NIST cybersecurity framework, NIST 800-53v5, NIST 800-37, ISO 27xxx, etc.
Knowledge of offensive tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), ideally completed training and/or certifications (OSCP, CEH, Pentest+, etc.)
YOU WILL BE OFFERED:
Career development in a fast-growing company with a clear business strategy
Opportunity to expand international experience and build global professional relations
Competitive benefits package (incl. health & life insurance, pension plan, meal & sports cards)
3 days of paid volunteering leave our employees can use to support the cause of their choice
Convenient location (next to Rondo Daszyńskiego) with subway, tram and bus lines and comfortable office space with chillout areas, free coffee/tea & fruit supply
26 days of leave per year for all the employees

About Standard Chartered 
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity,  together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:

Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do

Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well

Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

wsparcie konkretnego zespołu (zespołów) odpowiadającego za jeden z kluczowych produktów

25.title: Test Tools Developer – C#
25.description:
Come create the technology that helps the world act togetherNokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

With more than 3.500 patent families essential for 5G we have a strong 5G portfolio and are a front runner in open and virtualized radio access networks (O-RAN and vRAN).You have unique opportunity to be part of Baseband & SoC development unit, team of the experts developing and testing system modules hardware and platform software, the essential parts of the mobile telecommunication systems deployed worldwide, with strong focus on leading 4G, 5G and upcoming 6G technologies. 
What you will learn and contribute toWe look for highly motivated and skilled C# Developer with a very good knowledge/experience in OOP. Your software development know how will be applied in company’s own set of internal applications highly utilized by integration and verification teams for emulation, simulation and debugging different configurations and scenarios with Nokia Baseband and Radio HW products.As part of our team, mainly you will:
Design, develop, test, and maintain set of applications simulating some parts of BTS environment
Create and execute Unit as well as Regression Tests to prove applications run with the highest quality
Flexibly apply various of development technologies
Work in close co-operation to local project people but also with remote stakeholders
Contribute to software features from testers perspective, by implementation additional solutions and following technology progress 

Your skills and experience
Master's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Telecommunications, Software Technology, or equivalent education
2 - 3 years+ proven experience in software development
Fluent knowledge of OOP
Extensive knowledge of .NET with usage of C#
Very good familiarity with TDD
Ensure high quality of code
Experience in applications testing (Unit Tests, Regression Tests)
Skills in WPF and/or Windows Forms
Extensive practice in Microsoft Visual Studio IDE
Know-how of GIT versioning system
Ability to work with standardization technical documentation (like ETSI, 3GPP)
Creativity and analytical thinking
Problem solving skills with strong drive for results
Advanced English
It would be nice if you also had knowledge/experience with:
MVVM
REST API
Python or similar scripting language
Good code design patterns
At least basic knowledge level of Linux platform (Shell, Bash)
Expertise in telecommunication systems, radio frequency technologies
Knowledge of high-speed data interfaces used in telecommunication technology
Proven contribution to testing scripts and frameworks development
 What we offerNokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered. 
Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employerNokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation 

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

26.title: Software Engineer in Test
26.description:
Reference Number: SDEP1022 

The Role: We are looking for an experienced SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) - Python to join our QA team. You will work with world class specialists in a friendly, supportive and open-minded environment on. challenging goals that will help you to grow professionally and achieve new technical levels. This role will focus on improving and monitoring product quality via test automation framework development and test coverage extension for functional and performance suits. You will work with the most valuable part of the product - a Forex brokerage core. If you enjoy working with pure API, Python, cutting-edge technologies, Kafka and AWS, this role is for you!

Build CI/CD pipelines and integrate automation scripts into CI tools 
Manage any issues that may arise and drive resolutions throughout the testing process 
Share technical expertise with the rest of the QA team  
Actively participate in the Software Development Life Cycle and Software Testing Life Cycle 
Main requirements:
BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar
Minimum 2 years of comprehensive experience in quality assurance

Strong hands-on experience in designing and developing frameworks using Python
Strong technical background 
Experience in testing REST API 
Experience in performance testing 
Confident knowledge of Git 
Experience in agile software development methodologies and testing procedures 
Strong interpersonal skills 
Very good written and verbal skills in English 
 
The following will be considered an advantage: 
Experience with asynchronous and multithreading programming 
Experience in testing web sockets 
Experience in Robot Framework 
Experience with Docker 
Experience with Prometheus, Grafana 
Experience in testing Kafka broker 
Experience in the Finance/Forex domain 
 Benefit from:
Attractive remuneration package 
Food allowance
Intellectually stimulating work environment
Continuous personal development and international training opportunities
Attractive relocation package and support for a smooth relocation for you and your family 
Type of employment: Full timeLocation: Cyprus, Greece, Remote Please visit our website www.xm.com/careers to submit your online application for this position. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality!

31.description:
🌐 Trochę o nas:

Tworzymy uznane na świecie oprogramowanie do zarządzania metadanymi – dokumentowania baz i narzędzi danych (ETL, BI, itp.), profilowania danych, odkrywania i dokumentowania przepływów danych (data lineage), itp. 
Jesteśmy firmą produktową. Rozwijamy i sprzedajemy własną aplikację. Z zyskiem. 💰💰💰 Działamy w modelu subskrypcyjnym i mamy $2M+ ARR 
Mamy ponad 400 aktywnych klientów, głównie w Stanach i UK, a wśród nich takie marki jak Disney, LA Clippers, Fujitsu, Intel, the U.S. Department of the Treasury i dużo więcej 🚀 
Nasi klienci wysoko oceniają nasz produkt: 4,6 na Gartner Peer Insights i 4,8 na Capterra 
Jeden z naszych klientów napisał: “To oprogramowanie ma wszystko co zostało mi obiecane i nawet więcej” - co doskonale oddaje naszą filozofię działania 
Jesteśmy 40-osobowym zespołem z Polski i USA. Pracujemy w 100% zdalnie 🐱‍💻 

Sprawdź, czy ta oferta jest dla Ciebie

🎯 Jako Junior IT Admin BĘDZIESZ:

Rozwiązywać bieżące problemy związane z systemami informatycznymi, udzielać wsparcia technicznego dla użytkowników 
Zarządzać dostępami do systemów informatycznych (baz danych, aplikacji, skrzynek e-mailowych i licencji, itp.) 
Tworzyć nowe środowiska, instalować aplikacje oraz utrzymywać istniejące usługi 
Monitorować i optymalizować działanie obecnej infrastruktury 
Przygotowywać procedury i dokumentację techniczną 

☝️ Jesteś idealnym kandydatem/idealną kandydatką, jeśli:

Znasz system operacyjny Windows oraz protokoły sieciowe 
Potrafisz rozwiązywać problemy techniczne 
 Komunikujesz się płynnie w języku polskim i angielskim 

📌 Mile widziane:

Doświadczenie w administracji serwerami baz danych 
Wiedza nt. systemu operacyjnego Linux 



📝 Dlaczego warto do nas dołączyć? 

Będziesz pracować w firmie działającej na szybko rozwijającym się rynku zarządzania metadanymi, data governance, data quality 
Twój głos będzie miał znaczenie, a dobre pomysły i inicjatywy dot. rozwoju firmy i produktu będą doceniane 
Zyskasz przestrzeń na własne pomysły – raz w roku mamy wewnętrzny hackathon Innovation day, w 2022 roku 4 pomysły z niego trafiły do produktu 
Dołączysz do małego, zgranego zespołu, który się wspiera, pomaga sobie nawzajem i dzieli się wiedzą. Wysoki eNPS = 59 potwierdza zadowolenie zespołu z pracy w Dataedo 
100% praca zdalna – pracujemy z różnych miejsc w Polsce i w USA 
Elastyczny czas pracy - i to taki naprawdę 
Wynagrodzenie: 6,000 – 9,000 PLN netto na fakturze (B2B, pakiet dni wolnych), 5,000 – 7,500 PLN brutto na umowie o pracę 
Dajemy potrzebny sprzęt - laptop, monitor, dodatkowe akcesoria 
Pakiet benefitów: prywatna opieka medyczna (100% finansowana przez firmę), karta Multisport, home office bonus, budżet edukacyjny 
Spotkania integracyjne – w ciągu roku nie brakuje okazji, aby spotkać się na żywo (workation dwa razy w roku, Christmas Party), ale jeśli masz ochotę, codziennie porozmawiasz z zespołem online w wirtualnej "Kuchni," dołączysz na firmowy Update Meeting i zdalną integrację 😉 

📅 Jak wygląda proces rekrutacji?

Zadanie praktyczne – znajdziesz je w formularzu rekrutacyjnym, to wycinek Twoich przyszłych zadań w zespole produktowym. Dzięki temu zrozumiesz nasze wyzwania i od razu sprawdzisz, nad czym będziesz pracować. 

Video call – ok. 30-minutowa rozmowa z Asią, z naszego Działu HR, na której dowiesz się więcej o Dataedo i dzięki temu od razu sprawdzisz, czy to dobre miejsce dla Ciebie. 

Rozmowa rekrutacyjna online – zaprosimy Cię na rozmowę, w której weźmie udział Łukasz, Head zespołu Development i Marcin, IT Admin w Dataedo – dla nas to okazja, aby jeszcze lepiej ocenić Twoje doświadczenie, a dla Ciebie kolejna szansa na poznanie Dataedo. 

Finalna decyzja/oferta - gratulujemy i zapraszamy na pokład Dataedo! A później na krótką rozmowę, aby omówić szczegóły dot. współpracy. Niezależnie od tego, jaka będzie nasza decyzja, wrócimy do Ciebie z feedbackiem.

The Role: We are looking for a Senior QA Software Test Automation Engineer to join our QA team.  You will work with world class specialists in a friendly, supportive and open-minded environment on challenging goals that will help you to grow professionally and achieve new technical levels. You will work with high load public API of Forex brokerage application, web-sockets, REST API. Python and Robot Framework will be your main instruments for implementing functional and performance testing. You will extend the existing testing framework with libraries and auto-test using advanced Python technologies.
The main responsibilities of the position include:·        Work in close collaboration with the development team to help produce high quality software ·        Understand and translate business requirements to technical requirements·        Enhance software delivery and quality throughout the entire software development cycle ·        Perform automated functional and performance testing ·        Design and develop the test automation framework, implement required libraries and auto-tests ·        Maintain CI pipelines and integrate automated scripts into CI tools ·        Manage any issues that may arise and drive resolutions throughout the testing process ·        Share technical expertise with the rest of the QA team  ·        Actively participate in the Software Development Life Cycle and Software Testing Life Cycle Main requirements:·        BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar·        Minimum 4 years of comprehensive experience in quality assurance ·        Minimum 3 years of practical experience in test automation using Python ·        Practical experience in testing REST API, web sockets and Git ·        Experience in agile software development methodologies and testing procedures·        Experience in writing queries for SQL and NoSQL databases·        Strong communication and interpersonal skills ·        Very good written and verbal skills in English  
The following will be considered an advantage: 
Working knowledge of Robot Framework 
Experience with asynchronous and multithreading programming 
Experience with Docker 
Experience with Prometheus, Grafana 
Experience in testing Kafka broker 
Experience in the Finance/Forex domain 
 Benefit from:
Attractive remuneration package  
Food allowance 
Intellectually stimulating work environment
Continuous personal development and international training opportunities
Attractive relocation package and support for a smooth relocation for you and your family 

Type of employment: Full timeLocation: Cyprus, Greece, Remote Please visit our website www.xm.com/careers to submit your online application for this position. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality!

35.title: Sr TechnicalCurriculum Developer/Trainer
35.description:
The Engineering Enablement & Education team is responsible for addressing the technical learning and knowledge needs of all engineers that develop Splunk products. The programs and solutions delivered by the team enable technical productivity and engineers’ growth to meet career goals. Our team’s goal is to build an extraordinary engineering organization through learning and knowledge sharing. Programs and solutions delivered by the team include technical onboarding, Tech Talks, internal technical documentation, code labs, technical training classes, and hackathons.

We’re seeking a Senior Technical Curriculum Developer/Trainer who will be a force multiplier to upskill thousands of engineers by analyzing, designing, implementing, and delivering extraordinary learning and knowledge sharing programs. This role is critical to help the team scale and will influence the shape of the knowledge sharing culture at the company.

What You’ll Be Doing:

Learn from our engineers to understand how Splunk products work and how our software is crafted, developed, tested, and deployed
Follow instructional design best practices to analyze knowledge gaps, assess training needs, and develop engaging live or self-paced learning programs
Create and maintain classroom content, labs, and codebases
Teach one or more technical classes
Assess the efficiency of learning programs and how they have impacted productivity and business objectives
Act as a consultant to stakeholders to provide the most effective ways to improve learning, technical documentation, and knowledge sharing within their organizations
Manage the delivery of training programs crafted by yourself or others
Develop or maintain tools that optimize training delivery and operations
Foster a culture of learning that promotes inclusion and diversity in our teams, interactions, and learning models

Who You Are and What Makes You Qualified:

Demonstrated ability to learn technical concepts
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with a diverse group of technical subject-matter experts to build, maintain and deliver technical content
Experience developing software in C++, Java, Python, Javascript, or similar programming languages
Experience in technical curriculum development, technical writing, or delivering live classroom training
Understanding of how software engineers learn and acquire new skills and knowledge
Experience with elearning or video editing tools such as Articulate Storyline, Rise, Camtasia, Vyond, Descript
Ability to assess knowledge gaps and learning needs through various data points
Knowledge of Learning Management Systems
Ability to optimally collaborate with geographically distributed teams

Education:

Minimum of 5+ years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science or a related field. 

Join us as we pursue our vision to make the world a place where data provide clarity, elevates discussion, and accelerates progress for everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.

36.title: Software Tester
36.description:
Kim jesteśmy?
Cześć! Nie jesteśmy, jak większość, ale jak większość ciągle poszukujemy osób do naszych projektów. Develtio to Software House, mający oddziały w Katowicach, Rzeszowie i Warszawie. Można powiedzieć, że już jesteśmy wszędzie – wdrożyliśmy standardy pracy zdalnej. Nasz zespół to ponad 40 os. i teraz potrzebujemy Ciebie, aby dostarczać jakościowe produkty dla naszych klientów.
Możesz pracować w biurze w Katowicach, Rzeszowie lub Warszawie albo całkowicie zdalnie - wybór pozostawiamy Tobie. :)
Budujemy zespół luźnych i zaufanych relacji. Nie wierzymy w zarządzanie hierarchiczne – wszyscy jesteśmy równi i wszyscy zmierzamy w jednym kierunku. Tworzymy niepowtarzalne projekty informatyczne, zachowując najwyższe europejskie standardy.
Jeżeli wiesz jak zdenerwować developera kolejnym bugiem, jesteś zaangażowany(a) i dbasz o jakość to zapraszamy do naszego zespołu. Ważne! Nie szukamy po prostu testera. Szukamy osoby, która dopasuje się do zaangażowanego zespołu i będzie pilnowała jakości produktów dostarczanych dla naszych klientów.
Do Twoich obowiązków będzie należało:

Tworzenie test planów, scenariuszy i przypadków testowych
Przeprowadzanie testów aplikacji webowych
Wsparcie zespołu podczas testowania aplikacji
Raportowanie błędów
Wprowadzanie contentu w celu weryfikacji poprawności przygotowanego przez deweloperów rozwiązania w CMS

Wiele nie wymagamy, ale jednak:

Minimum 2-letnie doświadczenie na podobnym stanowisku
Znajomość zagadnień z zakresu aplikacji webowych / serwisów internetowych
Dokładność oraz bardzo dobra organizacja pracy
Umiejętność tworzenia test planów i scenariuszy testowych

Umiejętność analitycznego myślenia
Samodzielność i konsekwencja w dążeniu do celu
Otwartość na nowości z branży IT

Znajomość systemów kontroli wersji (GIT/SVN)
Umiejętność tworzenia dokumentacji funkcjonalnej

Znajomość języka angielskiego umożliwiająca swobodną komunikację (projekt dla anglojęzycznego klienta) - warunek konieczny

Doświadczenie w testach automatycznych - mile widziana znajomość Cypress

Zapewniamy:

Pakiet prywatnej opieki zdrowotnej
Comiesięczny budżet integracyjny
Elastyczne godziny pracy
Możliwość pracy zdalnej
Wdrożenie i doskonały proces onboardingu
Udział w budowaniu zespołu i skalowaniu firmy
Pracę w zgranym zespole
Narzędzia do pracy (laptop, telefon)
Realny wpływ na swoją pracę i karierę

Jak aplikować?

Nie wymagamy standardowego CV. Jeżeli je masz to super, podsyłaj ;) Możesz jednak wysłać też uzupełniony profil na LinkedIn, swoją wizytówkę online lub cokolwiek, co pozwoli nam poznać przebieg Twojej kariery. Mamy szybki proces decyzyjny, pracę można rozpocząć nawet w ciągu kilku dni. Jak wygląda proces rekrutacji na stanowisko Software Testera?
1.  Zapoznajemy się z Twoją aplikacją i zapraszamy Cię na rozmowę, gdy stwierdzimy, że możemy do siebie pasować. ;)2.  Rozmowa z Pauliną z działu HR – podczas rozmowy chcemy Ciebie lepiej poznać, dowiedzieć się jakie są Twoje oczekiwania względem przyszłego pracodawcy itd.3.  Rozmowa z QA Team Leadem - Kacprem – podczas rozmowy Kacper będzie chciał poznać Ciebie, Twoje skille oraz poprosi Cię o wykonanie jednego zadania, podczas którego będziesz mógł/mogła zaprezentować swoje umiejętności testerskie. ;)Po pozytywnym zakończeniu etapów rekrutacji, przechodzimy do składania oferty współpracy.Do zobaczenia! :)

37.title: Senior Cloud Operations Engineer
37.description:
Join a dynamic and innovative team at Arla Foods as a Cloud Operations Engineer. As a senior specialist, you'll be responsible for maintaining and supporting our cutting-edge Analytics Platform, working within a DevOps team to ensure operational stability and contribute to continuous improvement. If you have a passion for cloud computing, extensive experience with Microsoft Azure, and a desire to work for a forward-thinking company, this could be the role for you. About the jobWe are currently seeking a Cloud Operations Engineer to join our IT team in Gdansk. In this role, you will be responsible for the maintenance, support, and deployment of Arla's cloud-based analytics platform. You will work as apart of our DevOps team to ensure the smooth and reliable operation of our platform, and will act as a mentor and technical guide for junior team members. Also constantly assessing the support offering and providing feedback to improve our ways of working. Specifically, you will:
Ensure that all developments can be operationalized by communicating developmental needs early in the DevOps cycle
Gain, store, and retain knowledge that can be shared and understood by the wider team and future operational resources
Act as the go-to person for colleagues across IT
Provide feedback and suggested improvements for ways of working
Act as a mentor and trainer for junior team members to support their technical development
Continuously learn and use that knowledge to keep pushing Arla forward
Be part of the DevOps team responsible for supporting Arla's Analytics Platform
Support analytics capabilities using Azure PaaS tools, SQL, and/or Python in a Spark-based Analytics Platform
Contribute to the operational stability of Arla's Analytics Platform architecture
Review product work, including detailed code, from platform contributors for approval to deploy; provide technical feedback as needed
Ensure that there is minimum interruption of services
Participate in building automation into DevOps pipelines
Innovate and develop new ways of monitoring and providing insights to our platform and solutions built on top
Step in as SRE chapter lead as required to ensure shared ways of working
                                                 Who are you?
Strong problem-solver and trouble-shooter
Experienced in operational tasks.
Ability to work well in a team environment, and to mentor and guide junior team members
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment
Forward thinking and creative person.
Adaptability and Collaboration are natural assets that you use everyday.
 Furthermore, you have:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
At least 4 years of experience in a similar role, preferably working with cloud services in Microsoft Azure
Working knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Databricks/Spark, and other related services is essential
Proficiency with Python, ARM, and SQL would be a major advantage
Experience with ServiceNow is also an advantage
 What do we offer?• Flexible working time (start your day of work between 7-9) and home office work possibility• Trainings with experts & professional induction in a new position• Financial support of your education • Medical care & life insurance • Additional benefits like gym card, vouchers, travel points or cinema tickets, etc.• Scandinavian working style & no dress code• Home kit – monitor, laptop, keyboard, mouse, headsets, webcam• Referral program for employees• Employee Assistance Program (legal, psychological, health, financial consulting, etc.)• Support for your healthy lifestyle (fruit day, facility for sportsmen, sport challenges and activities, Arla active teams / sport groups) … while in the office you can also use some of below: • Modern office space with beautiful view and high standard furniture (i.e., adjustable desks)• Chill-out rooms with X-box, pool table, board games, football table and swing Application and contactIf you want to drive innovation and help your colleagues worldwide, then seize this exciting opportunity. Welcome to Global Shared Services in GdanskArla is a global farmer-owned organisation behind many well-known and well-loved brands.You will become a part of our Global Shared Services in Gdansk. You will join over 580 colleagues dedicated to supporting all of Arla. We currently have an IT Operations department and an IT Solutions department dedicated to SAP as well as a variety of app development and implementation projects. Our Procurement, Finance and Logistics departments support a wide range of processes such as purchasing, distribution and sales worldwide.We have a dedicated HR operations department that ensures the attraction, development and retention of the best talent around the world.Our newest department Member Relations supports our farmers in their everyday work.With over 14 years of existence in Gdansk, we offer you wealth of knowledge and the opportunity to participate in challenging and exciting innovation projects. As a part of the Arla organisation, you will also enjoy a Scandinavian, collaborative work culture.

40.title: Specjalista ds. cyberbezpieczeństwa IT
40.description:
Twój zakres obowiązków
Współudział w procesie oceny dojrzałości w zakresie cyberbezpieczeństwa i rekomendowanie koniecznych działań,
przeprowadzanie analiz, audytów i testów bezpieczeństwa aplikacji, sieci i systemów IT, np. określone testy penetracyjne (w podstawowym zakresie własnoręcznie oraz przy współpracy z Partnerami zewnętrznymi),
rekomendowanie/wdrażanie systemów wspomagających monitorowanie bezpieczeństwa IT oraz ochrony przed atakami informatycznymi,
wsparcie w procesie wytwarzania oprogramowania pod kątem zapewnienia standardów bezpieczeństwa,
rozwijanie i utrzymywanie ochrony infrastruktury przed zagrożeniami cybernetycznymi,
identyfikacja zagrożeń, obsługa cyberincydentów oraz raportowanie,
budowanie/podnoszenie wśród pracowników firmy świadomości bezpieczeństwa (ang. security awareness).
Nasze wymagania
Praktycznego doświadczenia w obszarze monitorowania bezpieczeństwa IT z wykorzystaniem przeznaczonych do tego narzędzi analitycznych,
znajomości rozwiązań klasy Incident Management, SIEM oraz innych technologii i rozwiązań z dziedziny bezpieczeństwa informatycznego,
praktycznej wiedzy i doświadczenia z zakresu podsawowej analizy i obsługi incydentów bezpieczeństwa IT,
znajomość technologii MS Windows Server, Linux/Unix Server, rodziny protokołów TCP/IP i usług sieciowych,
znajomości zagrożeń sieciowych oraz systemów bezpieczeństwa z tego obszaru (np. firewall, WAF, IPS/IDS, VPN, DLP, antyDDOS, itp.),
umiejętności przeprowadzania analizy ryzyka oraz analizy zagrożeń i podatności infrastruktury IT,
znajomości standardów z obszaru bezpieczeństwa IT (np. NIST, ISO 27001),
mile widziana certyfikacja potwierdzająca zdobyte umiejętności i doświadczenie w obszarze bezpieczeństwa IT.

Mile widziane
Certyfikacja potwierdzająca zdobyte umiejętności i doświadczenie w obszarze bezpieczeństwa IT.
To oferujemy

Dowolność przy wyborze formy zatrudnienia B2B lub umowa o pracę,
niezbędne narzędzia pracy,

41.title: Software Engineer Intern (Scala)
41.description:
Do you want a career that's not just ordinary?
Working in Ocado Technology means being a part of positive team players with curious minds who build technology that makes a tangible difference in the way the world shops. From personalised checkout experiences to automated warehouses and optimised delivery routes, we've shaped industries and created new ways of doing things, and we're just getting started. We're on an exciting journey, innovating, delivering, optimising and scaling - this makes for a special kind of work environment. Is it right for you?
We are looking for Scala Software Engineer Interns who want to make an impact and have fun along the way. Find out more about our traineeship program and the recruitment process. Visit page.

Get paid to engineer your future with our summer internship – starting July 2023
 We are looking for top tech students and professionals starting their careers in the IT industry with a burning desire to increase their knowledge in solving challenging problems. The internship itself may differ slightly depending on the team you will join, but for sure you will get a great taste of what it’s like to work across the company and face real business challenges. You will get support from senior software engineers and other experts to help you develop professionally.  
Tech stack: Scala / Scala wanna-be
Work condition: 8000 PLN gross monthly, a civil contract, hybrid way of working
Future tasks that will boost your career:

Participating in real projects with the help of more experienced colleagues developing great code running on production environments across the globe
Working on improving all stages of the software development life cycle 
Taking part in developing functionalities of our unique end-to-end online grocery delivery platform Ocado Smart Platform (OSP) 
Benefit from working with other engineers, tech-ops, product managers, UX designers/researchers, data analytics and your buddies.
Taking your programming skills to the next level through participation in different workshops and being close with products you will be working on
Coffee breaks and networking with an incredible team who value collaboration, trust, craftsmanship, learning fast and autonomy :) 

 
You will be a perfect fit if you: 

Are a curious 2nd year or above computer science or other IT-related fields tech or maths student, or a proactive professional looking to get into tech.
Can use Java (at least but bonus points for Scala)  to solve real tech problems.
Have great communication skills in English and Polish on B2 level minimum.
Value collaboration and have a desire for continuous learning in new technologies.
Are able to work full-time for 3 months (with 5 days of' holidays) and want to continue working with us when the program ends – 24 hours/week, Monday-Friday.
What’s in it for you?

REAL IMPACT: you’ll develop great code running on production environments across the globe

COMPETITIVE SALARY: 8000 PLN gross monthly on civil contract

UNIQUE CULTURE: unique software engineering culture with a high level of test coverage and agile environment 

CAREER BOOST: the possibility of a permanent contract as a Junior Software Engineer role starting in October 2023. 

MENTORSHIP: support from senior software engineers and other experts to help you develop professionally.

HYBRID MODEL: remote and in-office working with five days paid holiday.

TECHIE WORK CONDITIONS:  two-screen setups, games rooms, collaborative and creative workspace. 

FUN: meetups, delicious office breakfasts and pizza parties, team building events and many community groups like running, cycling and volunteering. 
APPLY!

Minimum 2 letnie doświadczenie komercyjne z aplikacjami opartymi na frameworku Django/DRF oraz bibliotece React

Mile widziane i przydatne dla nas będzie również Twoje doświadczenie w: Google Cloud Platform

Twoja praca będzie miała wpływ na życie i zdrowie pacjentów
Otrzymasz budżet szkoleniowy i wsparcie naszych mentorów

49.title: Senior Android Engineer
49.description:
Svitla Systems Inc. is looking for a Senior Android Engineer for a full-time position (40 hours per week) in Poland. Our client is a remote-first company that serves over one million drivers and over 100,000 businesses that power the physical economy by building technology to improve the safety, productivity, sustainability, and profitability of businesses that power the physical economy. Their Automated Operations Platform combines IoT hardware with AI-powered applications to automate vehicle and equipment tracking, driver safety, compliance, maintenance, spend management, and more. The client serves over 120,000 businesses across various industries, including trucking and logistics, construction, oil and gas, food and beverage, field service, agriculture, passenger transit, and delivery. Today, the company’s team comprises over 4,000 employees worldwide, supporting many customers. Ideally, the candidate should have experience with KMM/KMP (Kotlin Multiplatform) and Bluetooth/BLE. The role involves refactoring/modernizing code around the Bluetooth peripheral integration and converting some Java code to KMM/Kotlin to share it with the iOS app. The Tech Stack is a mix of the older languages with the newer ones, both Java and Kotlin for Android. The rest of the stack is standard, with MVVM for newer parts of the codebase and MVC for the older parts.

Requirements:

5+ years of experience working on Android apps.
Experience with Java and Kotlin.
Knowledge of UIKit, Activity Lifecycle, custom views, Retrofit, Dagger2, Reactive Programming, or database/persistence.
Knowledge of Version Control Systems (ex: Git, Mercurial, etc.).
Experience with Bluetooth/BLE.
Experience with shipment to Google Play Store.
Working hours till 7 pm CET due to cooperation with the US team.


Responsibilities:

Develop new features for the client’s Android App (Java & Kotlin).
Improve one of many existing features, including Compliance, GPS tracking, Safety, Bluetooth and USB comms, Camera APIs, etc.
Work with the product team to refine feature specs.
Communicate with back-end engineers about API requirements or refinements.
Help the support team to diagnose user problems.
Analyze the user's data to identify bugs.


We Offer:

Salary of 6 300 - 7 300 USD/per month on a B2B contract. 
US and EU projects based on advanced technologies.
Competitive compensation based on skills and experience.
Annual performance appraisals.
Flexibility in workspace, either remote or in our welcoming office. 
Comprehensive medical insurance after one month.
MultiSport card with access to 2500 sports facilities all over Poland
Bonuses for recommendations of new employees.
Bonuses for article writing, public talks, other activities.
15 vacation days, 10 national holidays, sick leaves, family days off.
Educational activities reimbursement on the monthly basis.
Free webinars, meetups and conferences organized by Svitla.
Gifts for birthdays, New Year and other holidays.
Fun corporate celebrations and activities.
Awesome team, friendly and supportive community!

About Svitla:
Svitla Systems is a global trusted IT solutions company headquartered in California, with business and development offices throughout the US, Latin America, Europe, and Asia. Svitla is an outspoken advocate of workplace flexibility, best known for its well-established remote culture, individual approach to our teammate’s professional and personal growth, and family-like environment.
Since 2003, Svitla has served a wide range of clients, from innovative start-ups in California to mega-large corporations such as Ingenico, Amplience, InvoiceASAP and Global Citizen. At Svitla, developers work with clients’ teams directly, building lasting and successful partnerships, as a result of seamless integration with on-site processes. 
Svitla Systems’ global mission is to build a business that contributes to the well-being of our partners, personnel and their families, improves our communities, and makes a lasting difference in the world. Join us!

O projekcie
Obecnie poszukujemy PostgreSQL Developera do długofalowych projektów dotyczących m.in.: rozwoju systemów wewnętrznych oraz aplikacji bankowych, z których korzystają miliony klientów. Praca zdalna, okazjonalna praca zespołowa z biura klienta w Warszawie (2 dni w miesiącu). Zadania

Prowadzenie prac projektowych i implementacyjnych w systemach informatycznych opartych o technologie PostgreSQL
Projektowanie algorytmów, implementacja procesów ETL i obliczeniowych, zarówno w narzędziach ETL, jak i własnym kodzie SQL / Python
Projektowanie baz danych i martów raportowo-analitycznych oraz udostępnianie danych narzędziom raportowym klasy BI
Opracowywanie i wdrażanie mechanizmów kontroli jakości danych
Projektowanie testów jednostkowych/funkcjonalnych/regresji
Oczekiwania

Min. 3 lata doświadczenia w pisaniu i optymalizacji zaawansowanych zapytań SQL.

Bardzo dobra znajomość SQL również w zakresie budowy procesów ETL (projektowanie, implementacja oraz wdrażanie rozwiązań ETL).

Bardzo dobra znajomość PostgreSQL (również w zakresie optymalizacji silnika i modelu danych)
Dobra znajomość narzędzi raportowych: Grafana, Power BI, QlikSense/View
Min. 2 lata doświadczenia w programowaniu z użyciem języka Python

Min. 2 lata doświadczenia w pracy w środowisku zautomatyzowanych procesów CI/CD i w zakresie projektowania raportów
Praktyczne doświadczenie z zakresu projektowania i programowania hurtowni danych oraz systemów informacyjnych

Oferujemy


Jawność finansową: wynagrodzenie w wysokości: 23 520 – 28 560 PLN (140 – 170 PLN/h) + VAT


Przejrzysty model rozliczeń. Konsultanci 7N wiedzą, jaką dokładnie marżę z tytułu opieki na projekcie pobiera 7N. 

Wsparcie w rozwoju zawodowym. Dofinansowujemy szkolenia i certyfikaty techniczne, udział w konferencjach oraz naukę języków obcych. Dodatkowo Konsultanci mają możliwość uczestniczyć w szkoleniach wewnętrznych oraz szkoleniach rozwijających kompetencje interpersonalne w ramach 7N Secret Code, który poznasz tutaj: 7N – The Secret Code) 

Możliwość skorzystania ze wsparcia (oraz dołączenia do) 7N Inspiration Team, grupy aktywnie dzielących się wiedzą w branży Konsultantów 7N. 

Współpracę z faktycznymi ekspertami (średni staż zawodowy Konsultanta 7N: 10 lat). Sprawdź jeden z naszych paneli dyskusyjnych: Czy Scrum Masterowi przydaje się background programistyczny ? - YouTube 
Całościowe wsparcie na projekcie osobistego opiekuna-agenta. Priorytetowe traktowanie ciągłości projektowej i jakości realizowanych projektów. Zobacz wypowiedź Konsultanta 7N o roli Agenta i możliwościach projektowych. 

Liczne (ok. 10-12 w roku) i stojące na najwyższym poziomie eventy – zarówno w formie offline jak i online). Zobacz relację z 7N Kick Off 2021: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VH2Wt0E6Azg 
Dofinansowanie opieki zdrowotnej i karty Benefit Multisport oraz ubezpieczenia na życie niezależnie od formy współpracy. Dostęp do platformy wsparcia psychologicznego i rozwoju osobistego Mindgram. 

Profesjonalny, jakościowy proces rekrutacyjny prowadzony przez najbardziej doświadczonych w branży rekruterów. Przeczytaj o badaniu satysfakcji kandydatów z rekrutacji w 7N.

58.title: .NET Developer
58.description:
Are you ready to join an MyBusiness Team implementing global platform for Hearing Care Professionals? Do you want to gain experience with platform and challenges that are hidden behind platform used across the globe?  
Then you may be a .NET Developer we are looking for! 

You can be a part of very experienced team in Warsaw Global IT division. We are international and distributed team with core development located in Warsaw with Product Owner very close to us who helps us to make this platform better and better. We need passionate developers to help us with this journey.  The Area  Platform that you will be extending is web based, designed for desktop and mobile. It’s global platform that is used across the globe, starting from Australia and Japan, through Europe and South Africa, ending on United States. We have sometimes very interesting global infrastructure cases that you’ll not have in local systems. We have CI/CD that makes deployments easy and fast, and we do it very often, really agile way. System integrates with internal systems, like ERP or Master Data.  The Job  In the role as .NET Developer your main responsibilities will be to implement new features based on architectural guidelines, as well as change and optimize existing solution. An ideal candidate is an passionate .NET developer with Azure Cloud background. Main responsibilities:  
Extending existing platform with new features written in C# based on .NET 6
Design and develop agreed solutions in distributed architecture 
Conduct code reviews with colleagues 
Work close with developers to ensure team deliveries 
Review and provide input to requirements 
Stay updated on new OO-design trends and technologies 
Ensure the guidelines, standards and practice 
Keep high quality of delivered code 
Write unit-tests 
Support existing platform 
Work with Kanban process and keep the application lifecycle  



What do you need to be a successful in this role?  
Minimum 3 years of programming in C# for commercial projects 
.NET + ASP.NET Core experience with web services and web applications programming skills 
Knowledge about concept of REST API 
Experience in React (preferably with TypeScript) 
Experience in Agile – we work in Kanban 
Quality focus and thoroughness in general 
Understanding of the software lifecycle processes and strive to ensure constant care for architecture, code base, test and documentation 
Fluent in English 
Suitable for travels to Denmark 

 Nice to have: 

Knowledge of Design Patterns 
Microsoft Azure experience with Storage, Cosmos DB or Search Services 
Azure DevOps experience 
Basic knowledge of Sitecore platform 



Who are we?
We are part of the world-leading hearing healthcare group Demant, which offers solutions and services that help people with hearing loss connect and communicate with the world around them. The company operates in a global market with companies in more than 30 countries, employs more than 14,500 employees and generates an annual revenue of DKK 14 billion. While the story of our Warsaw office begins in 2016 with a software R&D technology centre, we are now focusing on global hearing healthcare projects, gaining new competences and expanding our expertise in various business areas.  We work closely together with teams located around the world. By combining our knowledge, we can offer customers and end-users both the benefit of the latest technology as well as valuable insights into hearing health. We strive to have the most skilled specialists in the world. Therefore, we trust that all of them do their job in the best way, using all their skills and knowledge. You can be sure that every day will be a challenge. We want you to be heard and make hearing easier for others.

Możliwość rozwoju zawodowego

W dokumentach rekrutacyjnych prosimy o dodanie następującej klauzuli:„Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych przez DahliaMatic Sp. z o.o. z siedzibą w Warszawie, ul. Gottlieba Daimlera 2 zawartych w dokumentach aplikacyjnych na potrzeby obecnego i przyszłych procesów rekrutacyjnych.”Uprzejmie informujemy, że dokumenty złożone bez wymaganej zgody na przetwarzanie danych osobowych nie będą rozpatrywane i dane osobowe w nich zawarte nie będą przetwarzane. Informujemy, że aplikacji nie odsyłamy. Dokumenty aplikacyjne nierozpatrzone w danym procesie rekrutacji niezwłocznie będą usuwane. Dokumenty aplikacyjne, na przetwarzanie których otrzymaliśmy zgodę w przyszłych procesach rekrutacyjnych będą usuwane po upływie 5 latach od daty ich otrzymania. Dane osobowe kandydatów nie będą przetwarzane w żadnym, innym celu.Jednocześnie informujemy, że skontaktujemy się tylko z wybranymi kandydatami.

60.title: Senior Soa Engineer
60.description:
We are looking for a highly-skilled SOA developer to work closely with our team of analysts and app developers. As an SOA developer, you will be offering technical support, monitoring existing SOA composites, and designing and implementing new solutions.
A successful candidate will have impeccable knowledge of SOA principles and practices, proven experience implementing processes and security authentication, and a solid background in business process analysis and functional design. The ideal candidate will have excellent written and verbal communication skills, and be highly driven and disciplined.

creating design documents.
Working with DevOps & ELK.

Bachelor's degree in computer science, IT, or related fields.
2 to 5 years of Hands-on Development expertise in BPEL , OSB, J2EE is a MUST.
Experience using Oracle SOA Suite 11g or 12c framework for designed technical solutions based on business processes.
Experience in using File Adapter, Database Adapter, FTP adapter, JMS Adapter, SAP adapter for integration using Oracle Service Bus and for development of business processes using Oracle BPEL Process Manager
Understanding of SOA & OSB principles and practices.
Experience with all areas of SOA & OSB architecture.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

A competitive salary and good compensation package
Flexible and personalized career growth

Education reimbursement

Memorable anniversary presents
